result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin J Crandall was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Kevin J Crandall was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
12/16/15:  Per Victim Witness Coordinator restitution is paid in full. 

Defendant to pay all court costs, restitution, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

NOTE: non probation case count 2 is payable during extended supervision also.Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant Kevin J Crandall in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2. State moves to dismiss count 3.  Court accepts plea, finds the defendant guilty. PSI requested.State will recommend count 1: 9 yrs total, 3 yrs confinement 6 yrs extended supervision, restitution Count 2: 1 yr jail concurrent. Alcohol/Drug Influence Report

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. SCRAM upon  release from jail the same day.

Defendant Kevin J Crandall in court, in custody.  Adam Y Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Defendant will retain Attorney Gruen for future proceedings and did not request public defender for bail hearing. Court finds probable cause on face of complaint. Defendant given copy of complaint to read. State requests $2500 cash with conditions.     Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
